content: not to twist your stitches place a marker at the beginning of the row 𓋼𓍊 knit the cuff ribbing k1 p1 for a total of 12 row leg 𓋼𓍊 join mc and k for 4 row 𓋼𓍊 increase row *k8 inc1* 8 times you will now have 72 sts 𓋼𓍊 knit chart 1 adding in cc2 as you get to it the chart is knitted from bottom to top right to left with each row knitted twice for both sides of the sock be sure to keep your floats loose twisting the yarns for long floats i twist no more frequently than 7 stitches after completing the chart cut cc2 leaving enough tail length to weave in 𓋼𓍊 decrease row *k7 k2tog* 8 times you will now have 64 sts 𓋼𓍊 k mc for 15 row heel flap use cc1 for the heel and heel flap i have worked the heel using a basic slip_stitch heel as this is what i prefer but feel free to incorporate your favourite heel the heel flap is knitted flat back and forth turning your work as you go count 32 stitches from the bor and place a second stitch marker these will be the stiches used for the heel you can transfer the heel flap stitches to dpns if you find it easier after working a row or two you will see the divide between the heel stitches and foot is very clear so the markers are no longer needed 𓋼𓍊 rs *s1 pearl wise k1* repeat for the 32 heel sts turn work 𓋼𓍊 ws s1 pearl wise p to end of row turn work repeat the two row above 16 times until you 32 row total this creates 16 stitches down the side of the heel flap to pick up later pg 3 pattern copyright sophie skinner 2022 for personal use only heel turn continue working the heel in cc1 to change the direction of the heel you will work a series of short decrease row on the heel stitches turning your work at the end of each row it may seem a little odd and overwhelming if you have not knitted a heel before but i promise if you follow the pattern it will work out 𓋼𓍊 rs s1 k18 ssk k1 turn your work 𓋼𓍊 ws s1 p7 p2tog p1 turn your work 𓋼𓍊 rs s1 k8 ssk across the decrease gap on previous row k1 turn your work 𓋼𓍊 ws s1 p9 p2tog across the decrease gap on previous row p1 turn your work repeat this pattern of s1 knitting rs or pearling ws until 1 stitch before the gap previous row decrease either ssk rs or p2tog ws across the decrease gap followed by either k1 or p1 as you were knitting previously then turn your work continue repeating these row until all the stitches have been used ending on a ws row turn your work to the right side you should now be left with 20
